partial_orders.reason: Both edits perform an identical textual addition of 'HTTPS:///' to lists of URLs in test methods. They follow the same pattern (adding the same string in the same position relative to existing 'https:///' entries) and target the same type of syntactic construct (string literals in test data lists). This appears to be part of a single, contiguous refactor to add uppercase HTTPS protocol testing across multiple test methods. The edits are mechanically identical substitutions that would naturally occur together in one uninterrupted micro-task.

Both edits modify the same function `is_safe_url` and are part of a single coherent change to add scheme validation. Edit 0 updates the docstring to mention 'safe scheme' while Edit 1 implements the actual scheme checking logic. The docstring change in Edit 0 directly corresponds to the implementation change in Edit 1 - they reference the exact same function and the docstring update describes the behavior being added in the implementation. This creates a direct code-driven relationship where either edit naturally prompts the other as the next step in completing this feature enhancement.
